fs.gui
Class SwingAppender

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  fs.gui.SwingAppender
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceDependent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class SwingAppender
extends javax.swing.JLabel
implements ResourceDependent

This class implements a component, that can display log4j logger messages. It consists of a JLabel (from which it is derived) for displaying messages with an icon. It can activate a larger log history window on double click. The icon itself represents the current status of the application: All OK, warning, or erroneous. This status is, in fact derived from the level of the last logging message. The status to be derived from a logging level can be configured. By default everything up to INFO is OK, WARNING yields a warning and everything above is an error.
A user can append his own application messages, though it would make more sense to wrap these messages in a logger.
The component's output is controlled via an internal LogHistoryModel, by default with a slightly different layout than the default one.

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

SwingAppender

public SwingAppender(java.lang.String logHistoryTitle,
                     ResourceReference r,
                     PolyglotStringLoader l,
                     java.lang.String langID)
Constructs a SwingAppender. The label text is empty, the icon indicates ALL OK. The parameters are also used to initialize the associated LogHistoryWindow

Parameters:
logHistoryTitle - The title of the associated LogHistoryWindow
r - The resource reference used to obtain the icons. If null, the default reference is used
l - The string loader used to obtain the tooltips and similar
langID - The ID of the language in which this component should display its native texts

SwingAppender

public SwingAppender(java.lang.String logHistoryTitle)
Constructs a SwingAppender using the default resource reference and string loader and the global language id.

Parameters:
logHistoryTitle - The title of the associated LogHistoryWindow
Method Detail

getWindow

public LogHistoryWindow getWindow()
Returns:
The LogHistoryWindow which saves the logging history of this component.

setWindow

public void setWindow(LogHistoryWindow window)
Sets the window which saves the logging history of this component. If the parameter is null, this call is ignored.

getModel

public fs.gui.SwingAppender.ForwardAppender getModel()
Returns:
the appender which forwards logs to the label and the LogHistoryWindow. This is the appender that should be added to any Loggers the messages of which should be displayed in this component. For manipulating output format however, the LogHistoryWindow or the labelAppender have to be obtained.

getLabelAppender

public org.apache.log4j.Appender getLabelAppender()
Returns:
the appender used to print log messages to the label. This appender should not be added directly to any logger. Instead, the forwardAppender should be used, since it forwards logs to the label appender and the log history window

getLastLevel

public org.apache.log4j.Level getLastLevel()
Returns:
The Level of the last message appended

getLogHistoryModel

public LogHistoryModel getLogHistoryModel()
Returns:
The data model of the associated LogHistoryWindow
See Also:
LogHistoryWindow.getModel()

setOkIcon

public void setOkIcon(javax.swing.ImageIcon okIcon)
Sets the icon for ALL OK to the specified parameter. You should call reloadIcon() afterwards to make the change immediately visible

Parameters:
okIcon - the okIcon to set

setWarnIcon

Parameters:

saveLog

public void saveLog(java.io.File f)
             throws java.io.IOException
Delegates the call to LogHistoryWindow.saveLog(java.io.File). Tries to save the log history to the specified File.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
LogHistoryWindow.saveLog(java.io.File)

reloadIcon

public void reloadIcon()
Sets the label' icon according to the level of the last message and repaints. This message should for example be used after a change of icons

reloadResources

public void reloadResources()
Reloads the icons and sets the label's icon to the appropriate one.

assignReference

public void assignReference(ResourceReference r)
Assigns a resource reference (but does not reload anything) If r == null, the default reference is used. The resource reference of the associated LogHistoryWindow remains untouched.

Specified by:
assignReference in interface ResourceDependent

getExpectedResourceStructure

public org.dom4j.Document getExpectedResourceStructure()
This class expects to find three icon graphics in a folder (basedir)/graphics/SwingAppender/, that is ok.png, warning.png and error.png and the fsframework string table language/fsfwStringTable.xml

Specified by:
getExpectedResourceStructure in interface ResourceDependent
See Also:
ResourceDependent.getExpectedResourceStructure()
